intro: Saccolabium dasypogon, commonly known as the hairy pod sida, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing capsules that contain numerous seeds. Saccolabium dasypogon is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
